tool.name: CreateDischargeMap

param.name: in_drainage_line
param.dialogReference: The input drainage line features that compose the stream network.

param.name: in_discharge_table
param.dialogReference: The input discharge table created with the Create Discharge Table tool.

param.name: out_discharge_map
param.dialogReference: The output discharge map in .mxd format. The discharge map document may contain one single layer or multiple layers with scale-dependent mapping of drainage line features.

param.name: in_unique_ID_table
param.dialogReference: The input unique ID table previously created together with the input discharge table using the Create Discharge Table tool. The default value is None.

param.name: in_layer_info
param.expression: {Layer Name {Minimum Scale} {Maximum Scale} {Minimum Stream Order};Layer Name {Minimum Scale} {Maximum Scale} {Minimum Stream Order}...}
param.dialogReference: The multi-layer information about the layer name, map scales and the stream orders of drainage lines that are copied into the database and rendered at the corresponding scales. The default value is None and in this case all drainage line features are copied into the database and rendered in a single layer.

tool.summary: Creates a discharge map document for stream flow visualization based on the discharge table and the draiange line feature class.
tool.usage:
• The input drainage line features are not necessarily in 1-to-1 relationship with those in the input discharge table. Only the matching drainage line features between the two inputs will be displayed in the output discharge map.

  • If the unique ID table is not specified, unique IDs will be extracted from the input discharge table, which causes extra computation time in tool execution.

  • You should specify the reciprocals of the actual scale values as the input scale values. For example, use 2,000,000 when your scale is 1:2,000,000.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates a discharge map document for stream flow visualization based on the discharge table and the draiange line feature class.
